title.native: 超電磁マシーン ボルテスV

description:
From out of nowhere, a mysterious alien race known as the Boazan Forces has invaded the Earth. A group of individuals specially trained to handle this kind of situation has been unleashed. Kenichi, Ippei, Daijirou, Hiyoshi & Megumi are the pilots of the Choudenji Machine Voltes V (5), Earth's defense against the Boazan and their terrible Beast Warriors. The plot thickens as the Go Brothers discover their true heritage and the truth behind their father's disappearance. Conflicts and mixed emotions hinder the Go Brothers at times but due to their unwavering desire to find their dad, they must go to the place where it all started. With the help of the rebels based on Earth and on the aliens' homeworld, the Voltes Team has another mission, remove the tyrant Zu Zanbajil and liberate the people of Boazan.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

name.native: ラ・ゴール＝剛健太郎（ごうけんたろう)

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/富野由悠季) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino)

Yoshiyuki Tomino is an anime creator best known for creating the Gundam anime franchise.

Began his career in 1963 with [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/)'s company, [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/), scripting and directing episodes of the first Japanese anime television series, [Astro Boy](https://anilist.co/anime/2747/). He later became one of the most important members of the anime studio [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), going on to direct numerous anime through the '70s, '80s and '90s. He is perhaps best known for his transformation of the "Super Robot" mecha anime genre into the "Real Robot" genre with 1979's [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), the first in the Gundam franchise.

Known for using numerous pseudonyms.

(Source: Wikipedia)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Y_HIJIRI)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Y_HIJIRI)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Y_HIJIRI)

__Birth Name:__ Toshio Hayakawa (早川俊夫)
__Place of Birth:__ Tokyo, Japan

A highly prolific and an extremely influential animator.

Know for his experimentation with the timing of keyframes, his dynamic poses, and his peculiar effects Kanada pioneered a number of techniques and concepts that permeated and shaped the Japanese animation industry, influencing not only his peers but also the generations to come.

Kanada's ability and his tendency to be very personal with his drawings, even to the point of ignoring storyboards if the situation required, popularized in the industry the concept of letting the individual animator's talents shine instead of being uniformed into anonymity. This precept is still respected today and it's one of the reasons Japanese animation is so distinctly unique. His career is also a testament to his ethos that expressive and vibrant animation is not achieved simply through increasing the number of frames but through playing with movement, poses and timing.

In the early '00s, Kanada became an employee at Square Enix.

Notable Square Enix titles in which he was credited:

~!
- 2002, Final Fantasy XI (Motion Capture, Animation Director)
- 2005, Musashiden II: Blade Master (Storyboard)
- 2006, Dawn of Mana (Facial Setting)
- 2007, Final Fantasy 4 DS Version (Storyboard)
- 2009, Final Fantasy XIII (Storyboard Director) - *Posthumous credit.*
- 2011, Final Fantasy XIII-2 (Storyboard) - *Posthumous credit.*
- 2012, Dragon Quest X (Storyboard)  - *Posthumous credit.* !~

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷口守泰)

A veteran animator with a career spanning nearly 60 years.
Started his career at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1963. Later went freelance to further pursue his career as a scriptwriter.

Tadao Nagahama was a director of both puppet shows and animation.

He is best known as the director of Sunrise and Toei Company's Robot Romance Trilogy, which added human drama to the Super Robot Genre. Nagahama also directed several hit anime series that are still well known among Japanese viewers. Moreover, he produced hits with works of all genres, including sports, comedies, shounen, shoujo, and Super Robots. He has been referred to as "the Emperor" in imitation of film director Akira Kurosawa.

 He and his wife contracted hepatitis while traveling overseas. Although his wife survived, he died from the disease at the age of 48.

[Website](http://www1.s-cat.ne.jp/manga-do-honpo/) | [Blog](https://manga-do.hatenablog.com/)

Originating as an Animator from [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/Tatsunoko-Production). However, he soon left the company and moved to [Mushi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/68/Mushi-Productions).

He became a freelancer in 1969, and started working as a director around this time. He wasn't active in the industry during the 2000s but eventually returned.

Founder of Frontier Enterprises.

__Height:__ 153 cm

Mitsuko Horie is a Japanese seiyuu and singer. She was born in Yamato, Kanagawa, Japan. She is most known to American anime fans as the voice of Sailor Galaxia, but in all Latin-America she is know as the "Candy-Candy" opening theme singer.

Koorogi'73 is a Japanese Chorus-Unit.

The correct name in Japanese is Koorogi Nanajuusan and means Cricket'73.

They disbanded after 1990.

name.native: コロムビアゆりかご会

node.description:
Columbia Yurikago Kai was established in 1933. They are a children's choir group that changes their members over the period of time.

The Columbia Yurikago Kai is part of Otowa Yurikago Kai (音羽ゆりかご会). Their members are singing the chorus for anime, children's songs, nursery rhymes and songs from the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology.

They belong to Columbia Music Entertainment.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E6%9E%97%E4%BA%9C%E6%98%9F) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asei_Kobayashi)
